head.citation-title: 6D Pose Estimation of Texture-Less Objects on RGB Images Using CNNs
head.abstracts: Â© 2020, Springer Nature Switzerland AG.In this paper, we present a convolutional neural network-based approach to 6D pose estimation on RGB images segmented in advance. We designed and trained two neural networks to achieve reliable 6D object pose estimation on such images. The first neural network detects fiducial points of objects, which are then fed to a PnP algorithm responsible for pose estimation. The second one is an rotation regression network delivering at the output the quaternion. The neural networks were trained on our datasets containing both real images as well as photo-realistic images, which have been rendered on the basis of our 3D models. The performance of neural networks for object segmentation and 6D pose estimation was evaluated using both real and synthesized images. Experimental results demonstrate a high potential of our approach to pose estimation of texture-less objects observed by RGB camera and mounted on arm of the Franka-Emika robot.
